The California case in which the Pledge of Allegiance was found to be unconstitutional by a district court and by the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals was based on the inclusion of the words "under God." It had already been decided in the 1940s that a child can not be forced to recited the pledge, but the courts here decided that the recitation of the pledge including the words "under God" in a classroom is a violation of the Establishment Clause of the 1st Amendment.

It was meant to replace the right hand outstretched palms up because people participating eventually flipped their hands as they got tired. And during WWII, when that happened, the catchphrase became: "Hotsie-Totsie another little Nazi". So that's why the salute became right hand over the heart.
